reviewText:
I have played pcm 11,12,13,14 and now 15, so I can say that I have enough experience with the game to give a little review of it.

First off: you should only buy this game if you are really in to cycling and know how cycling works.
Because if you don't, you have no idea what to do and you don't know what you are doing wrong, because buying pcm without have knowlegde of cycling is like playing NBA without knowing anything of basketball, but even worse.

Now about pcm 15:

This game is still by far the best cycling game simulator on the market together with the tdf game for consoles that are also developed by cyanide.
But it is not perfect, oh boy,not at all.

In the new mode pro cyclist mode"

reviewText:
(i have played every PCM from 2009)
Oh boy, this is hard to say good or bad too.

In one way, it's a improvement with the new Pro Cyclist mode, which is quite cool..... when you leave the bugs out.

I mean, there's still bugs from the old versions...

But if its your first PCM - buy it. If you know cycling, because else you will not know what the ♥♥♥♥ you're doing.
If you've played PCM before, the only reason you should have to buy PCM 2015 is the pro cyclist mode.

To be honest, almost nothing has changed. A ♥♥♥♥ game if you're not interested in cycling, mediocre+ if you're like cycling and like the pcm series.

Alternatives?
There is none.. PCM has a monopoly in this kind of game, and therefore it's sadly the only choice. Is it a good choice? Kind of.

If i were to give this game a rating, i would rate it 6/10

reviewText:
* I have played this game a lot more, but not on steam.

This review only covers the new Pro Cyclist Mode.

Pro Cyclist Mode is a new game mode in Pro Cycling Manager 2015. You create your own rider, where you can choose your riders nationality, age, height and weight. You can also choose skin colour and a profile picture for your rider.
All in all you don't get a lot of customization options.

The big decision is in choosing your focus in your career; are you going to be a climber competing with Vroome and Contador or are you competing for the green jersey with Sagan.

Your starting stats are decided from what you chose as your focus, and the age of your rider.

As you start the game, you get the choice of 3 teams, usually from the country you chose. You can choose the worst team, and become the captain, or choose a higher ranking team, get access to bigger races, but having to ride for your captain.

When entering your main hub after choosing your team, you get into the familiar career menu. Only here you have less options. The only thing you can really adjust is your training schedule.

If you toughen up your training schedule, you will level up at a faster race, but of course you will suffer from more fatigue.

Leveling up increases your stats in what ever area you are trying to improve your rider in. If you are trying to win the Tour de France, you will quickly get improved Mountain, Time Trial and Restitution.

To level up, you can gain XP by training, finishing races in top positions and getting in the early breakaway.

In the races you can control your rider with 4 and 8 on the numpad to move him right and left. Or using 5 and 8 to increase or decrease his effort.

Unlike career mode, in Pro Cyclist mode you can't look at other groups other than the group, your rider is currently in, which means if you are in a breakaway, you can't see who is leading the chase in the peloton, and instead have to use other means to figure out how much of a chance you have of winning.

All in all this game mode is a great improvement to a game franchise which desperately needed a new game mode.

Check out my newly started Lets Play of the new game mode: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2H98Ce7kUWM

reviewText:
I have played almsot every pro cycling game for the last 8 years. I really like the 1st player career mode, only a few weeks into the season but it is a great addition to a game that over the last few years hasn't added much. Which is why typically I don't suggest buying the new game until it has been out a while. As always with a new game it will crash occastionally and I'm sure they will put out patches soon as the game as only been out 2 days now.

1st person career mode:
You determine what type of cyclist you want to be (sprinter, climber, stage races, et cetera).
Then pick your team, typically a contentional or contentional pro team.
You have a race director or tell you want he would like you do during the race (just like in old career modes you used to give to your riders). So he declares you the leader, or free element, or teammate, and gives specific instructions like don't attack, ride in the breakaway, follow counter attacks, et cetera.
You have a small number of points that you are allowed to use to adjust your race schedule during the year, which is nice when you want to get more training in.
You select how much workload for your training, which in effect hurts your freshness for when races come up, so you need to decide how many rest days you want.
Overall just a great addition, and as always if you like the career mode as a manager that has changed a little, they do R&D now on equipment, but quickly other than that I didn't see any major changes from previous version of the game.

So far I highly recommend this game if you like cycling. I will update if any major issues arise.

reviewText:
I personally am liking the game a lot.
Yes, its a little buggy and for the thirty five bucks I paid for it I do expect a game in the year 2015 to not have these types of issues. BUT...
I am a cycling fan but this is my first video game of cycling and I find the Pro Cyclist mode to be extremely fun and addicting.  Trying to wrap my head around all of the manager stuff on first boot up was too much to take on at the time so I thought I would try the individual first mode first...I love it.
After three seasons I am more than able to pick and choose what races I do, I just signed with Astana for big bucks and have only done one grand tour (Giro de Italia) so I am looking forward to the Vuelta and the Tour of course.
All in all I would recommend game as long as you have a relatively newer PC and all of your drivers must be up to date on the said newer hardware because it does have a few bugs at the moment.

reviewText: This game would be great if the developers were concerned at all about what people that paid $40 for. The idea and concept of the game is fantastic. The fact that the AI riders seem to react differently to my rider then the other 199 AI riders is flat ridiculous. Im not the top ranked rider so why can any other rider decide to breakaway but if I do or follow a breakaway the pack is right on my heels? How are riders able to maintain when they are completely out of both bars of energy? If that happens to me my rider drops back like hes sitting still. When is pro cyclist mode I can see my teammates killing themselves to keep up yet still maintain and recover as fast as I do when I keep my bars almost full. Then lets get to the crazy numberous amount of bugs that no one seems to be working on or care about as they are posted and made awhere of. Im into season 4 of pro cyclist and now all the sudden my mouse pointer freezes on the screen and you have to move your mouse around guessing where it is till you get lucky enough to scroll over something with it and the icon changes colors a tad. Yes the game is playable like this but I refuse to waste my time trying to figure out where my mouse is. Ive had the game over a month with alot of crashes and a pop up that asks me to send my data to help the developers work on a fix. I cant find anywhere that someone from the game has responded or gave info on any fixes for the future. I dont really write reviews but I feel like this time I didnt get even half my moneys worth when I cant continue to play the game and dont know if I ever will be able to.

reviewText: Terrible game. The majority of the race maps have not been updated from the previous edition and are based on 2013 routes. The interface has taken a huge backwards step and the rider fitness screen is now completley unreadable. Also the lack of Continental teams makes many 2.1 races pointless with sometimes only around 70-80 riders taking part (e.g. there are 6 UK Continental teams but once again only 2 make this game.) Considering that in the 2014 edition it only takes around 1 hour to fully set up a new team on the editor the lack of effort that has gone into the details of this game is insulting.\n\nI would advise you buy the 2014 edition instead as it will be cheaper, the maps are basically the same and the interface is far better.

reviewText:
This game is by far the best cycling game in the world. There are two main modes that are commonly played throughout the community (Career, and Pro Cyclist Mode)

Career-
The career mode is great if you like to control a whole team. The pros about this mode are it is easy to understand. You can change every aspect about your team and can master the manager part. It is always hard to choose which team you want to choose at the beginning of a career, and this game helps your choices. You can choose between any of the three   divisions to select your team (Cya World Tour, Contintental Pro, and Continental) You can filter alphabetically or by the amount of stars they possess (Overall Rating) The cons about this mode are, when selecting a team, they should also give you sponsor details (i.e. Sponsor Budget and Length of contract) Also in this mode there are no major advancements from pcm 2014. Overall this game mode is adicting and very fun. I would recommend this mode to anyone who likes a team and realistic aspect.

Pro Cyclist Mode-
This mode is amazing. You can control everything about your rider during the race and out of race (Height, Weight, Complexion, Nationality, you can even change the picture of your rider) The gameplay of this mode is outstanding. There are no downsides to this mode except you should be able to do something with the money you earn. I would reccoment this game to anyone who likes fantasy due to the fake Cyanide Cups at the beginning and the fact that you are not a real pro cyclist.

Overall this game is the best one out there. The gameplay is amazing no matter what mode you play in. It's super addicting and I can't stop thinking about it when I'm not at the controls. This game is for people who truly love the sport of cycling. If you don't know much about the sport, the tutorials will help you further your knowledge about professional cycling. I'll give it a 9.25/10 rating because of the crashes the might happen in the loading screen. Tip: Don't Click ANYTHING during the loading screen of a race.

reviewText:
This is the 4th or 5th time I have bough a version of PCM....and I keep getting dissapointed.

Many teams and riders are not licensed, so they have fake names. This can be corrected by downloading a community made database, which is very helpful...however still bothersome. Also the game has crashed quite a few times, and there are some periods in some of my games that I can get past because of this.

Overall I do enjoy the general feel of PCM, but the requirement of a custom DB and the many crashes makes me feel like I have wasted my money. Maybe I will buy another version in 2-3 years and see if anything has changed. Based on the history of this game series though, I doubt it will.

reviewText: OK.  I've spent over 550 hours playing the pro rider version of this game (which is a hell of a long time by anyone's version of addition).  But I haven't actually played it for an entire week.  Why?  Well for the 4th bloody time the game has just taken a huge investment of time and effort and just packaged the whole thing up and dropped a vast turd on the whole thing.  Entire well developed pro rider scenario just GONE.  Two times winner of Spain.  One time winner of Italy.  Fourth placed result in France.  BANG  whole thing gone.  Can see the cdb files in my documents, but the game just won't recognise them.  So I've tried loading them for a week, and now , just can no longer be bothered.  If Cyanide wants to get in touch with me with a solution I'd love to hear it.  But THIS IS THE FOURTH BLOODY TIME THIS HAS HAPPENED.  And even though I loved this game, it's just not worth the trouble.\n\nCreating a rider and investing hundreds of hours in their development does not deserve to be greeted with a complete scenario crash.  It is seriously not suitable for windows 10.0. When you've got a 2 Gb graphics card and the game only detects 115Mb in graphics memory, and you spend HOURS trying to fix this...  Too buggy.  Too temporamental.  Too heart breaking.  Yes DC Universe online can be bloody annoying, but compared to this game it's a walk in the park...  Immersing yourself in a senario and gthen having the whole thing just crashing is heart breaking.  Unless you are an idiot, DO NOT WASTE YOUR PRECIOUS TIME WITH THIS WASTE OF HARD DRIVE SPACE.

reviewText:
Oh, God...

Let's start by saying that sooner or later will have to pass some sort of law that distrust companies like this to bring out products that are not working , are untested  and are incomplete...

Several years of new versions, new features and then...

At the current time, the 3D race is... simply unplayable! For many players the 3D race simply fail to start and crash at the loading.

Then, well, one try to use the quick sim feature... and then discovers that the game simply crash MORE than the past versions.

We are talking about 20 total crashes for 4 hours of play, for now.

The new great features and game mode? Nice, but not very polished.
You gain money, but you can't do nothing with that; the developing of your player is so fast that you become a sort of Froome in a couple of season; and for the Career mode, the old bugs still persists.

However, the game at least introduce some new pretty design, a new, awaited, game mode, and a some nice improvements.

But, at the end, is still and always the same broken product!
It's frankly unacceptable!
This company is one of the biggest in Europe, and is still not able to solve bugs (stupid bugs, like stability bugs, not logical bugs!) before releasing his main product.

Finishing, don't buy the game now: you'll finish to asking Steam for a refund.
Wait, and check back in the following months, also checking for community mods.

reviewText:
Well, to cut it short, PCM 2015 is... an unexpected step behind :(.
There are two main problems that plague PCM 2015
The new Cyclist mode is great, it's a nice idea, but the AI seems weird. Whenever I simulate, I always get near last position, despite my cyclist being already decent stat-wise.

The second thing is... the UI. It's a disaster, I don't know what the devs were thinking. PCM's 2014 UI was perfect, it had a nice graphics, nice buttons, smart placements, everything.
Now:
- the menus are a mess.
- there are tons of UI bugs everywhere, going from buttons that can't be clicked on because there are UI elements over them, to scrolling pads not working.
- the new icons are ugly. And believe me, that's stuff that I usually can't care less about. But these look like they were made by a photoshop beginner, while last year's were pretty damn cool.
- the fonts are simply unreadable. Again, I just cannot understand why there was a need to change things. It was perfect in PCM 2014 but now everything is barely readable, and I'm mostly speaking - unfortunately - about the in-game races.
There's an option to expand the interface but if you do that, it'll lose focus, so it's still ugly to see.

I really hope that the patches will fix a few things but unfortunately I doubt that a complete overhaul of the UI will be considered, so this year is done. Sigh. I still can't go back to the old PCM simply because of the new Pro Cyclist mode. However, the reality is that, if it wasn't for that, last year's version is currently better.

That said, the perfomance of the game has improved, the loading is faster and the races are smoother. There are also some nice little new touches that make the experience in itself a bit better, but so far it's not enough.

reviewText:
This is basically a sports management game and not a cycling game. As far as I can tell I was never able to directly control someone riding a bike. The line which states “Pro Cyclist: a new game mode where you create and control a cyclist from the start of his career and turn him into an international star!“ does not mean you will ride a bike. I gave up on this game early so I won’t say much.  So I am writing simply as someone who plays video games.

Pros
•	Management tools
•	Decent graphics
•	Thorough tutorial
•	I am confident if you are into managing a cycling team and not into riding you will have a good time.

Cons
•	You don’t ride a bike
•	The world is kind of empty for watching cyclist ride around a track
•	You don’t ride a bike

reviewText:
Just don't bother buying this.

The list of bugs is soooo long..... Frequent crashes, loading of races freezing, wrong profile of races shown, all riders giving up in some simulated races,......

There was one thing that decides me to delete the game actually..... A mountainous Giro race, with finish on top of a mountain, won by a guy 6 minutes before the second.... the guy had the climbing stats of a rookie, (62 while any decent or good climber would have 70 - 80).

I could live with the boring races, that always end up the same way.... and I played even  through all the bugs. But one day it ends... That's today.

No more Cycling Manager for me. I've been patient, waiting for patches to improve things...... But since those aren't coming, this is the end.

reviewText: From only having a little knowledge of the cycling world I am now hooked. And what a sport it is. Pulling everything together to win the big jerseys feels like a marathon journey, and you can blow it on one little mistake. While most of the races are whizzed through in fast forward, its excellent for the multi-screening type of person. voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
I feared purchasing this product due to the reported problems. But enthusiasm ignited by the tour overwhelmed my fears. I purchased and installed the product, and it crashed on the first run. After looking at the PCM solutions page (in French), I found many recommendations centered around virus checking software.

I personally run McAfee Internet Security. So I decided to turn off real time scanning while running this program. Surprisingly, it has never crashed since. I tried to run it again later (after a couple of days) with real time scanning on, and again PCM crashed.

Thus, I am now having a blast with PCM as long as I turn off my real time scanning off while playing. Definately worth the purchase if you are an avid cyclist.

reviewText:
I LOVE this game! I bought Pro Cycling Manager 2015 without having bought any of the previous versions. The graphics are pretty nice and the game is just overall great! I've been a cycling fan for a few years now and it is my dream to be riding with the pros. The idea of Pro Cyclist Mode is fantastic. Being able to model a rider after me made the game soo much better.

I am a little annoyed at the loading times for each race if you choose to 3D race all the time. I understand that this is because the world is having to render. Apart from this minor let-down, I would happily recommend this game to ANY cyling fan.

The game does start to become not interesting" after a while however all you need to get you going again is creating a new Pro Cyclist.

The $20 I spent for in during a sale was well spent in my opinion."
